title: What makes a word redundant? - Quora

response.answer_text: if an idea has been expressed, then a word or phrase which repeats it is redundant. John was fired on the Friday when he was let go from his position. Alicia sat down and positioned herself on the seat. Alice cooked the meal by baking it in the oven. As he walked he strolled down the street. He pressed the keys with his fingers, typing his response to the message. Careful good precise English style avoids and refrains from using words or phrases that are repetitive and redundant.
